title: St Sunday Crag and Grisedale Tarn Walk Route

images.title: Andrew Smith / St Sunday Crag
images.caption: St Sunday Crag. The descent to Deepdale Hause on the ridge continuing to Fairfield. To the right is Grisedale Tarn with Seat Sandal beyond.

images.title: Michael Graham / Summit Cairn, St. Sunday Crag
images.caption: Summit Cairn, St. Sunday Crag The magnificent St. Sunday Crag apparently named after St. Mungo a local Celtic Saint. Helvellyn ridge on the skyline.

images.title: Path on Birks by Bill Boaden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Path on Birks. Three walkers and their dog on the path across Birks, east of the crag.

images.title: Michael Graham / Summit Cairn, Birks
images.caption: Summit Cairn, Birks. On the top of grassy Birks looking up at St. Sunday Crag and over to the Helvellyn range.

images.title: The gentle descent to Deepdale Hause by Bill Boaden, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: The gentle descent to Deepdale Hause

images.title: Andrew Smith / Deepdale Hause
images.caption: Deepdale Hause. The col between St Sunday Crag and Fairfield, looking towards the latter. The ridge initially climbs to Cofa Pike with the summit of Fairfield set back on the plateau beyond.

images.title: Peer Lawther from Leeds, United Kingdom, CC BY 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Grisedale Tarn

description: This challenging circular walk from Patterdale climbs to this prominent fell on the north-eastern ridge of Fairfield. The circular walk climbs to Birks Fell and then onto the 841 m (2,759 ft) of St Sunday Crag. There's fabulous views of the Helvellyn range, High Street and the lake below. The walk takes place on generally good footpaths on a splendid elevated ridge. You can start your walk from the pretty village of Patterdale at the southern end of Ullswater Lake. Then follow the trail south west out of the village to Birks Fell before climbing across St Sunday Crag. You then descend to the pretty Grisedale Tarn before turning round and returning to Patterdale via Grisedale Forest and Patterdale Common. To extend your walking in the area you could visit the lovely Aira Force Waterfall. The long distance Ullswater Way will take you on a tour of the area surrounding the lake. Wainwright's Coast to Coast runs through the area so you could continue along the path past Grisedale Tarn towards Seat Sandal where there are more splendid views.
